attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: Tougher law on paedophiles,prison sentences in category  of manslaughter
attributes.background: Its disturbing how a paedophile charged with 32 months imprisonment.Peterlee police say its the the worst footage they have ever seen. The judge  went beyond the sentencing guidelines . 32 months for 5,538 indecent images of children.also 95 hours of recordings. This sentence is pathetic
attributes.additional_details: http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/paedophile-jailed-possessing-worst-child-11807748

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: National vote to Legalise right to die
attributes.background:
Let there be a nationwide referendum to vote for the right to die,
In extreme circumstances A person should have the right to choose to legally and safely end their life

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: The public right of navigation on all rivers in the England and Wales
attributes.background: I would like parliment to allow public use of rivers and canals in England and Wales for small manually propelled vessels with a crew of up to 3 persons.
attributes.additional_details: In England and Wales there is less than 4% of the 41,000 miles (68,000km) of rivers have public access.

attributes.action: Issue Identity card for all legal residents of the UK that must be carried.
attributes.background: Our forces and emergency services have to carry ID, so why can't we all! The card can simply be linked to your NI number. Police, Immigration, the NHS and other public services can identify someone's eligibility for residency or any public service. It will only hinder those with something to hide.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we need this: Health Tourism of the NHS, fraud in our benefits system, illegal immigration and national security

Assist an already stretched Police Force, assist a stretched NHS and public services.

Immigration services can Identify illegal imigrants quickly and easily.

Use the identity card throughout multiple public services to assist with repetitive administrative functions.

It makes sense!!

attributes.action: Ban refugees entering Britain until we are out of the EU
attributes.background: We must stop anymore refugees arriving in Britain until we are out of the EU. And we can then control who comes with more secure checks in identities

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Fine people who smoke on hospital grounds or have security to escort them out!
attributes.background: I not only work in the nhs and see this on a daily basis .But I now have a 12 day old baby born at 25 weeks fighting for her life. And where people smoke in the hospital grounds the ward she is on is right above where everyone smokes and it travels right to her window! I've argued many times with
attributes.additional_details: The inconsiderate people smoking out the entrance of the ward. But they do not care and do not move as they know there is no one there to stop them! You can smell the smoke all through the corridor of the hospitals entrances . And other staff members don't even think to question the people doing it.They even sit in the wheel chairs outside smoking .Do the wheelchairs even get cleaned for when the porter needs it for the next patient? The signs are not enough !! This is at st Georges hospital.

attributes.action: Unban Tyler, The Creator from entering the UK
attributes.background: The US rapper Tyler, the Creator says he has been banned from the UK because of the nature of his lyrics however i believe this is unjust. He should not have been banned for lyrics he wrote 6-7 years prior and i believe his ban should be lifted, however he hasn't written lyrics like that since.
attributes.additional_details:
The letter from the secretary of state for the home department at the time sated in a letter sent to Tyler that his lyrics “encourages violence and intolerance of homosexuality” 

His manager went into more detail on his Tumblr, saying 
more importantly, this is a broader issue of free speech, the letter acknowledged he was writing from an alter ego perspective does this then apply to book writers? What message does that send? is race a conscious or subconscious factor at all?

attributes.action: Speed up DBS checks
attributes.background: Care companies are in crisis due to the waiting time for DBS checks. Staff only have to give a months notice to leave  but to get new staff to cover them can take months, It is hard enough getting staff to work in the care industry and many give up the wait after 4 weeks as need to be in paid work.

attributes.action: The National Curriculum to be run and controlled by an Education Council
attributes.background: Education has been used to sway voters for too long now. With each new Government comes a new National Curriculum. New 'ideas' or 'beliefs'. It's time for stability and for education to be in control of professionals and not politicians, by forming an Education Council of former Heads and teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010, the Education Department has been run by an accountant, a journalist, a solicitor and an economist. What qualifications do they have to decide on the best course of action for our children? The Government are too results driven. Schools should be places where children feel safe, where children go to enjoy learning, where children discover a passion for a given subject area. This is not happening under the current scrutiny from those who don't understand the education system.

attributes.action: Make PTSD a recognised illness for fair claim and recognition of PIP at DWP.
attributes.background: I would like the government to re-address the level of illness, disability and point scoring of PIP claims for PTSD. British people need fair claim for the illness that is debilitating and get the help in such times of need. There is apparent great need for this within the ex-services community.
attributes.additional_details: I tried claiming PIP on the encouragement of my social worker before medical discharg for PTSD. Following the interview for PIP, which was distresssing enough, I was given zero points, even though on the letter I received it stateded I obviously had some form of mental illness at this time. I could get nothing as it's not classed as a health condition or disability. I am well now but would have benefitted from the extra income, as I was unable to do many activitys of daily living due to my PTSD.

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Make Personal Development classes part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sources suggest that on average, children spend just under 800 hours in a classroom each year! During this time a range of subjects will be taught and skills will be gained. However, in the midst of Maths, Science, PE and others, when do you hear kids shouting "I'm off to Personal Development Class"
attributes.additional_details:
I do not have an issue with the standard of education our children get, but I want them to have an opportunity each week to work on Developing themselves, to learn and build on attributes such as Resilience, Self Motivation and Empathy to name a few. 

“A teacher has two jobs: fill young minds with knowledge, yes, but more important, give those minds a compass so that that knowledge doesn't go to waste.” - Mr Hollands Opus 1995 (movie)

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Ensure that in future 65% of eligible voters are required to pass a referendum.
attributes.background: For changes that would have a profound effect on the nation its constitution and its people a clear 65% of eligible voters should be the mark so there can be no doubt as to the legitimacy of the vote. In addition Parliament should be legally obliged to honour any passed referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Previous referendums are held at the first past 50% of those that voted is all that is needed to carry a referendum this could be seen as undemocratic as it is not based on the eligible voting public. Also allowing such tight voting margins can be seen to be a cause of civil unrest.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Remove UK passports from disorderly passengers who cause disruption on flights
attributes.background: Media report drunk passengers cause problems & alcohol should be banned on flights. Alcohol is not the problem it is disorderly people. Most travellers enjoy a drink & cause no problems. Like football violence,  remove passports if they cause disruption rather than ban alcohol

attributes.action: Employment Support Allowance needs to be changed for people who work.
attributes.background: After being signed off work due to Mental Health problems, I was extremely disappointed to find out that after DWP checked my last twelve months National Insurance contributions I didn't qualify for Employment Support Allowance. In the past 18 months I have reduced my hours due to health problems.
attributes.additional_details: If people are suffering with accident/illness it is fairly common that may have  to reduce their hours to help them through. Therefore, it would be better to no longer use the time limit of twelve months to check NI Contributions when calculating if they qualify for Employment Support Allowance. It think its fair to say it would be better to look at what has been paid for all the years they have worked. This ruling needs to be changed to support workers who are going through difficult times.

attributes.action: MAKE THE SPOUSAL VISA REQUIREMENTS ACHIEVABLE! STOP MAKING PEOPLES LIVES SO HARD
attributes.background: It Is Far Too Hard For People To Earn £18'600 Per Annum! Let Alone Have Savings Of £62'000! It Is Pathetic!!
attributes.additional_details: I Have Friends And Family Struggling Because Of This And It Is Just Not Right!!!

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ban packed lunches in schools and nurseries
attributes.background: Schools and nurseries in the UK have started to BAN packed lunches, some reasons for this include: Healthy eating and allergies. As parents, it should be a constitutional right to feed our own children.
attributes.additional_details:
I completely agree there should be a CLEAR packed lunch policy containing details of banned foods but to ban them all together is wrong. 

http://www.barnsleychronicle.com/article/parents-take-action-after-schools-packed-lunch-ban

http://www.spiked-online.com/newsite/article/banning-packed-lunches-a-slap-in-the-face-for-parents/15389#.V8CBAPkrKM8

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Make cycling in groups of over 6 a road traffic offence.
attributes.background: In the country side all weekend we are fed up of cyclists using our narrow lanes in large groups, this is incredibly dangerous to other road users, cars, horse riders, etc. They have very little regard or consideration for other people using the road.
attributes.additional_details: Getting very fed up of large groups of cyclists road racing with no stewards and no road closures with very little regard for other road users. If groups were limited to groups of 6 passing them down narrow lanes would be much safer for all.
